thread.title: Hoverboard 2.0 costs $10,000; tech used in NASA ‘tractor beam’
thread.title_full: Hoverboard 2.0 costs $10,000; tech used in NASA ‘tractor beam’ - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Benny Evangelista
title: Hoverboard 2.0 costs $10,000; tech used in NASA ‘tractor beam’
text:
Photo: Handout, Photo Courtesy Of Arx Pax A worker at Los Gatos startup Arx Pax works on the Hendo 2.0, the company's second-generation flying hoverboard. Ten of the Hendo 2.0 boards will be delivered on Oct. 21, 2015, the date depicted in the 1989 movie “Back to the Future Part II,” to customers who paid $10,000 each as part of Arx Pax's Kickstarter crowdfunding campaign last year. A worker at Los Gatos startup Arx Pax works on the Hendo 2.0, the...
Los Gatos startup Arx Pax is riding its hoverboard back into the future. A worker at Los Gatos startup Arx Pax works on the Hendo 2.0, the company's second-generation flying hoverboard. Ten of the Hendo 2.0 boards will be delivered on Oct. 21, 2015, the date depicted in the 1989 movie “Back to the Future Part II,” to customers who paid $10,000 each as part of Arx Pax's Kickstarter crowdfunding campaign last year.
